title: Ubuntu 24.04 snap Thunderbird 128.9.1esr lost its application icon
creator: web3451
content:
Sometime last week, my snap thunderbird package updated to version 128.9.1esr. After that update, clicking on the Thunderbird icon in the dock starts thunderbird under a generic icon that appears on the right side of the dock (showing the dot indicator under it), rather than showing the thunderbird icon with the running indicator under it.

I am using X11, fully updated Ubuntu 24.04.2, with Thunderbird installed as a snap. Work correctly until last week. If I start the application manually from the command line, same generic icon appears. (If I start firefox snap from the command line, the firefox icon shows the "running" indicator under it as it is supposed to.

Note: Thunderbird IS running and running fine - I have not found any other issues, just this potential regression.

Anyone have any ideas? I thought I would post here before filing a bugzilla bug report. I was not able to find any mention of this (or a similar) problem in the last year.

Thanks.
metadata: ;useragent:Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Ubuntu; Linux x86_64; rv:137.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/137.0

title: Problem after email is moved to trash folder
creator: rkymantas
content:
Hello,

I am facing the following problem. When I delete an email and it moves to the Trash folder, Thunderbird no longer displays inbox emails. Trash folder is displayed after archives folders. After restarting Thunderbird, it is restored again. I did an inbox folder repair, but it did not help. Then I deleted the Inbox.msf file and waited for the system to recreate it, but that did not help either. I also did compact folders ->general -> Disk space, but that did not help either. If I want to use the program, after each email moved to the trash, I have to restart Thunderbird. Please, I need help with solving this problem.

title: Unable to sign in to a Gmail account after upgrading Thunderbird to version 128.9.2esr
creator: inbox23
content:
Hello everyone,

I have a Thunderbird instance with some mail accounts, two of them have the address @campus.unimib.it and @unimib.it. They are really GMail accounts, only the domain is customized by my university. After upgrading Thunderbird to version 128.9.2esr (on Fedora Linux), the first time I started the application, it couldn't log on to the @unimib.it account, but it could log on to the @campus.unimib.it account. This was strange: I removed the @unimib.it account and tried to add it as a new account, but Thunbderbird could not connect. At the same time it can connect to @campus.unimib.it with the same settings. I have attached a screenshot of the problem, what could be the problem? Thunderbird does not show any informative output.

Thank you in advance, Have a great day!

title: How to override zebra striping for the current selected message
creator: kmcguire2
content:
I am using zebra-striping for my Thunderbird email (78.14.0, 32-bit), alternating between white and light green. This is generated by the following code in my userChrome file. (The forum seems to change my code after it's posted, but the attached screenshot shows the actual code):

/* Light green, high-contrast zebra stripes in message list */

  1. threadTree treechildren::-moz-tree-row(odd) {

-moz-appearance: none !important; background-image: none !important; /* background-color:#99E02E !important;} */ background-color:#EEFFBB !important;}

When the selected message is a white-stripe, the color switches to a light blue to make it stand out, but when the selected message is a green-stripe, it remains green and is only outlined in light blue, which makes the selected message difficult to identify.

How can I override the zebra-striping for *any* selected message (white or green stripe), such that the message is always light blue?
